You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Create a Page Include

To insert, extend, or override content in a specific location in a default page or widget, create a page include. A standard storefront page provides several default extension points for page includes. With a page include, you can easily customize the data or functionality for default components. For example, use a page include when you want to modify the data shown in the Mini Cart widget or add a button on the Shopping Cart page.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create Visualforce pages:	Customize Application
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

Other pages or components reference a page include with the <apex:include> tag. If a storefront configuration exists for the referenced content, the page or component shows the page include's content along with the page or component's default content.

NOTE
A page include can reference backbone.js views, handlebars.js templates, or other content that you want to show.
When you override default handlebars.js templates, consider using a separate Visualforce component for each override. Then, reference each component from your page include. We recommend this method of organizing your custom code for easier readability, maintainability, and reuse. For example, the default Checkout page references separate components for the shipping address, payment information, order summary, and so on.

To create a page include:

Create a Visualforce page that contains your page include's customizations.
To create a Visualforce page, complete the steps in https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.pages_creating.htm.
To ensure that the Visualforce page renders correctly, include each of the following attributes in the opening <apex:page> tag:
sidebar="false"
showHeader="false"
standardStylesheets="false"
applyHtmlTag="false"
<apex:page docType="html-5.0" sidebar="false" showHeader="false" standardStylesheets="false" applyHtmlTag="false">
TIP If the content doesn't require a controller, consider also including the cache="true" attribute.
Ensure that your page complies with the following guidelines:
Avoid using standard Visualforce controls, such as <apex:form>, within a page include. Visualforce pages restrict any controls in a page include to the same namespace, which is ccrz for default storefront pages. This dependency breaks references to default controllers.
If your Visualforce page's content requires a controller, use a merge variable—even an empty static final variable—in the page to avoid potential errors.
If your Visualforce page uses any action methods, create another Visualforce page for the action. Use an <apex:include> tag to reference the action page from the first line of your page. Use the same controller for both your Visualforce page and the action's Visualforce page.
Save your changes.
To use your custom Visualforce page in a page include, update your storefront configuration settings.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist (3), select the module that corresponds to the location on the page where you want to insert the content:
Body Includes Begin
Body Includes End
HTML Body Include Begin
HTML Body Include End
Header Include Begin
Header Include End
TIP For more information about each location, see Extension Points in a Storefront Page.

For example, to insert your custom content after the opening HTML <body> tag, select HTML Body Include Begin.

Find the Enabled configuration (4) for the page include, and click Override (5) in the Action column.
In the New Page Setting window, enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
In the New Page Setting window, enter the following values, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	The module that you selected in step 2.c
Configuration	Enabled
Page	The page where you want to use the page include. To use the page include on every page, enter all.
Value	TRUE
Find the Page Include Name configuration (6), and click Override (7) in the Action column.
In the New Page Setting window, enter the name of the Visualforce page that you created for Value, and click Create.
TIP Because this page is subscriber code that you've created and is outside of the managed package, prefix the page name with c__, such as c__cc_example_pageInclude.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
SEE ALSO

(Salesforce Developers) apex:form
(Salesforce Developers) apex:page

title: Visualforce Page Includes for B2B Commerce
